channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 06/09/25
item.content:encoded:
Even though the game’s long development had morphed into something of a meme, I don’t think anyone was truly prepared for just how big the launch of Hollow Knight: Silksong would be this week. Truly, it was close to being the GTA of indie game releases, with other indie developers doing what they could to avoid launching on the same day – of course, anything with a physical launch couldn’t really do that – and then all of the digital storefront feeling the crunch and stumbling as everyone rushed to download.

All of which is to say…. are you playing Silksong this weekend?

In the News This Week

We were quite light on the news front this week, but here’s the headlines:

  • 007: First Light gets a March 2026 release date
  • Sony is reportedly making the PS5 Slim Digital Edition worse
  • Borderlands 4 endgame and post-launch roadmap revealed
  • Sign ups are now open for new Netease MMORPG Sword of Justice’s closed beta
  • Street Fighter movie has begun filming, release date set for October 16th 2026
  • Sophie Turner is Lara Croft in Amazon’s live-action Tomb Raider series

Games in Review & Featured Articles

There’s plenty of anticipated games coming out this week, and while we don’t have a review in for Silksong just yet, we have covered a bunch of other bases.

  • Cronos: The New Dawn – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, PC – 8/10
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, PC – 8/10
  • Star Wars Outlaws Switch 2 – NSW2 – 8/10
  • NFL Madden 26 – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, PC – 8/10
  • Hell Is Us – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 7/10
  • Echoes of the End – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 7/10
  • Ra Ra BOOM – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 6/10

Heading back to our continuing Gamescom catch ups, I had a preview of the intriguing PvPvE horror shooter Project Spectrum, which was one of the flaming spade highlights of Opening Night Live, as well as checking in Hell Let Loose: Vietnam and its leap forward to a very different conflict to the WW2 original.

And then there was Bond, James Bond. Alongside the 007: First Light gameplay reveal, we were able to share our thoughts and impressions from what IO Interactive are creative, including an interview with Franchise Art Director Rasmus Poulsen.

And with Destiny 2 shoved right to his gaming back-burner, Tuff has been enjoying the new feeling experience provided by the mobile-first Destiny: Rising. Is this the Destiny 3 we’ve been waiting for?

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Silksong, Cronos and a return to Indiana Jones for the new DLC.

Trailer Park

Football Manager 26 matchday gameplay revealed

See the 007: First Light gameplay deep dive

Check out the Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake gameplay overview

Your Achievements

What have you played this week?

  • Andrewww continues to seemingly only ever play games that are just about to leave PlayStation Plus, giving Dead Island 2 and Night in the Woods a try. Alas, neither of them grabbed his attention, but the Alone in the Dark remake managed to survive past the opening few hours. He also continued his journey through Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, but now he’s got stick drift in one of his controllers so it trying for a warranty replacement. Good luck with that!

That’s the round up for this week, enjoy the improved weather for the weekend, and we’ll catch you back here on Monday!



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/06/something-for-the-weekend-06-09-25/
